HeaderRateLimitLimit.description: The maximum number of requests that a user can make within a specific time window.

HeaderRateLimitRemaining.description: The number of requests remaining in the current rate limit window before the limit is reached.

HeaderRetryAfter.description: The minimum time you should wait, in seconds, before retrying the API request. This header might be returned for 429 or 503 error responses.

collectionName.description: Human-readable label that identifies the collection.
collectionName.name: collectionName

databaseName.description: Human-readable label that identifies the database.
databaseName.name: databaseName

end.description: Date and time when MongoDB Cloud stops reporting the metrics. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC. Include this parameter when you do not set **period**.
end.name: end

envelope.description: Flag that indicates whether Application wraps the response in an `envelope` JSON object. Some API clients cannot access the HTTP response headers or status code. To remediate this, set envelope=true in the query. Endpoints that return a list of results use the results object as an envelope. Application adds the status parameter to the response body.
envelope.name: envelope

federationSettingsId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies your federation.
federationSettingsId.name: federationSettingsId

granularity.description: Duration that specifies the interval at which Atlas reports the metrics. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 duration format in UTC.
granularity.name: granularity

groupId.description:
Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies your project. Use the [/groups](#tag/Projects/operation/listProjects) endpoint to retrieve all projects to which the authenticated user has access.

**NOTE**: Groups and projects are synonymous terms. Your group id is the same as your project id. For existing groups, your group/project id remains the same. The resource and corresponding endpoints use the term groups.
groupId.name: groupId

identityProviderId.description: Legacy 20-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the identity provider. This id can be found within the Federation Management Console > Identity Providers tab by clicking the info icon in the IdP ID row of a configured identity provider.
identityProviderId.name: identityProviderId

includeCount.description: Flag that indicates whether the response returns the total number of items (`totalCount`) in the response.
includeCount.name: includeCount

indexName.description: Human-readable label that identifies the index.
indexName.name: indexName

itemsPerPage.description: Number of items that the response returns per page.
itemsPerPage.name: itemsPerPage

liveMigrationId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the migration.
liveMigrationId.name: liveMigrationId

orgId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the organization that contains your projects. Use the [`/orgs`](#tag/Organizations/operation/listOrganizations) endpoint to retrieve all organizations to which the authenticated user has access.
orgId.name: orgId

pageNum.description: Number of the page that displays the current set of the total objects that the response returns.
pageNum.name: pageNum

period.description: Duration over which Atlas reports the metrics. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 duration format in UTC. Include this parameter when you do not set **start** and **end**.
period.name: period

pretty.description: Flag that indicates whether the response body should be in the prettyprint format.
pretty.name: pretty

processId.description: Combination of hostname and IANA port that serves the MongoDB process. The host must be the hostname, fully qualified domain name (FQDN), or Internet Protocol address (IPv4 or IPv6) of the host that runs the MongoDB process (mongod or mongos). The port must be the IANA port on which the MongoDB process listens for requests.
processId.name: processId

sandboxConfigId.description: Unique 24-hexadecimal digit string that identifies the sandbox configuration.
sandboxConfigId.name: sandboxConfigId

start.description: Date and time when MongoDB Cloud begins reporting the metrics. This parameter expresses its value in the ISO 8601 timestamp format in UTC. Include this parameter when you do not set **period**.
start.name: start

reason.description: Application error message returned with this error.

fields.description: Describes all violations in a client request.

field.description: A path that leads to a field in the request body.

href.description: Uniform Resource Locator (URL) that points another API resource to which this response has some relationship. This URL often begins with `https://cloud.mongodb.com/api/atlas`.

rel.description: Uniform Resource Locator (URL) that defines the semantic relationship between this resource and another API resource. This URL often begins with `https://cloud.mongodb.com/api/atlas`.

links.description: List of one or more Uniform Resource Locators (URLs) that point to API sub-resources, related API resources, or both. RFC 5988 outlines these relationships.

info.description:
The MongoDB Atlas Administration API allows developers to manage all components in MongoDB Atlas.

The Atlas Administration API uses OAuth2 Service Accounts or HTTP Digest Authentication to authenticate requests. Provide a programmatic API public key and corresponding private key as the username and password when constructing the HTTP request. For example, to [return database access history](#tag/Access-Tracking/operation/listAccessLogsByClusterName) with [cURL](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CURL), run the following command in the terminal:

```
curl --user "{PUBLIC-KEY}:{PRIVATE-KEY}" \
  --digest \
  --header "Accept: application/vnd.atlas.private-preview-aws-transit-gateway+json" \
  -X GET "https://cloud.mongodb.com/api/atlas/v2/groups/{groupId}/dbAccessHistory/clusters/{clusterName}?pretty=true"
```

To learn more, see [Get Started with the Atlas Administration API](https://www.mongodb.com/docs/atlas/configure-api-access/). For support, see [MongoDB Support](https://www.mongodb.com/support/get-started).

You can also explore the various endpoints available through the Atlas Administration API in MongoDB's [Postman workspace](https://www.postman.com/mongodb-devrel/workspace/mongodb-atlas-administration-apis/).
info.title: MongoDB Atlas Administration API

get.description:
This API is in preview. Breaking changes might be introduced before it is released. Don't use preview APIs in production.

 Returns the Transit Gateway Attachments for this group in the shared Atlas AWS Account.
get.summary: Return All Transit Gateway Attachments for One Group

post.description:
This API is in preview. Breaking changes might be introduced before it is released. Don't use preview APIs in production.

 Creates Transit Gateway Attachment with the provided VPC for a Transit Gateway that has been shared with an Atlas AWS Account. This Transit Gateway will be used in Atlas Streams private networking connections.

requestBody.description: Metadata needed for creating a transit gateway attachment.

delete.description:
This API is in preview. Breaking changes might be introduced before it is released. Don't use preview APIs in production.

 Deletes a transit gateway attachment.

parameters.description: Unique identifier that identifies the Transit Gateway Attachment.
parameters.name: attachmentId

get.description:
This API is in preview. Breaking changes might be introduced before it is released. Don't use preview APIs in production.

 Returns one Transit Gateway Attachment for this group from the shared Atlas AWS Account.

parameters.description: Unique identifier that identifies the Transit Gateway Attachment.
parameters.name: attachmentId

get.summary: Return One Transit Gateway Attachment for One Group

get.description:
This API is in preview. Breaking changes might be introduced before it is released. Don't use preview APIs in production.

 Returns the AWS RAM Resource Shares and Transit Gateway IDs for a Transit Gateway that has been shared with an Atlas AWS Account. This only returns the resource shares cached for Atlas Streams Processing.
get.summary: Return All Streams Transit Gateway Invitations

delete.description:
This API is in preview. Breaking changes might be introduced before it is released. Don't use preview APIs in production.

 Deletes an AWS Resource Share Invitation for a Transit Gateway that has been shared with an Atlas AWS account. This does not delete the resource share invitation from the sender's AWS account. This only deletes the resource share invitation that's cached for Atlas Streams Processing.

parameters.description: AWS Transit Gateway resource share ARN.
parameters.name: resourceShareArn

204.description: This endpoint does not return a response body.

get.description:
This API is in preview. Breaking changes might be introduced before it is released. Don't use preview APIs in production.

 Returns the details of one AWS Resource Share Invitation for a Transit Gateway that has been shared with an Atlas AWS Account. This only returns the resource share invitation cached for Atlas Streams Processing.

parameters.description: AWS Transit Gateway resource share ARN.
parameters.name: resourceShareArn

post.description:
This API is in preview. Breaking changes might be introduced before it is released. Don't use preview APIs in production.

 Accept AWS RAM Resource Share for a Transit Gateway that has been shared with an Atlas AWS account. This Transit Gateway will be used in Atlas Streams private networking connections.

requestBody.description: Detailed information on accepting a transit gateway resource share invitation.

204.description: This endpoint does not return a response body.

post.summary: Accept Transit Gateway Resource Share Invitations

post.description:
This API is in preview. Breaking changes might be introduced before it is released. Don't use preview APIs in production.

 Rejects AWS RAM Resource Share for a Transit Gateway that has been shared with an Atlas AWS account.

requestBody.description: Detailed information on rejecting a transit gateway resource share invitation.

204.description: This endpoint does not return a response body.

post.summary: Reject Transit Gateway Resource Share Invitations

get.description:
This API is in preview. Breaking changes might be introduced before it is released. Don't use preview APIs in production.

 List Transit Gateway routes in the default route table associated with Atlas VPC.
get.summary: Return All Transit Gateway Routes in the Default Route Table for One Atlas VPC

post.description:
This API is in preview. Breaking changes might be introduced before it is released. Don't use preview APIs in production.

 Creates a route in the default route table associated with Atlas VPC to route all traffic destined for provided CIDR to the provided Transit Gateway.

requestBody.description: Metadata needed for creating a transit gateway route.

post.summary: Create One Transit Gateway Route in the Default Route Table for One Atlas VPC

delete.description:
This API is in preview. Breaking changes might be introduced before it is released. Don't use preview APIs in production.

 Deletes a transit gateway route in the default route table associated with Atlas VPC.

parameters.description: The Object ID that uniquely identifies a transit gateway route.
parameters.name: routeId

delete.summary: Delete One Transit Gateway Route in the Default Route Table for One Atlas VPC
